p: Harsini ( 207) observed through colony counting that rinse solutions made from the A. occidentale bark ethanol extract (1, 2, 3, 4, and 5%) influenced C. albicans adherence to acrylic resin. The number of colonies ranged from 1757.50 to 670.00 CFU/mL, showing better results than the control (1912.50 CFU/mL).
